name: Folding Ninjas - Origami Club with Roligami
description: Not every gathering needs to be a formal workshop! Our Casual Fold & Connect Nights are all about relaxed creativity, sharing, and building community through Origami. Whether you’re seeking a new hobby, a meditative practice, or a creative outlet, the Folding Ninjas welcomes you! No prior experience is necessary—just bring your curiosity and enthusiasm.Absolute Beginners: We’ll help you get started with some easy folds!Intermediate Folders: Opportunity to refine techniques and learn and seek help from fellow foldersAdvanced Practitioners: Space to experiment, teach others, and push creative boundariesMeet-Up StructureWelcome and Warm-Up (30 minutes)Check-In: Grab your name tag and settle inIce-Breaker Activity: A quick origami-related game or quick fold to get everyone engagedSkill Level Check-In: Beginners are paired with experienced folders for personalized guidanceFree-Form Folding (60 minutes)No Structured Instructions but beginners will be provided with guidanceBring your own projects or start something newCollaborative and spontaneous foldingFree exchange of techniques and ideasShow and Share (30 minutes)Members showcase their completed projectsConstructive feedback and celebration of individual achievementsInformal networking and social timeWhat to BringBeginners: Nothing! We provide all materialsExperienced Folders:Your own specialty papers (optional)Any unique tools or templates you’d like to shareCompleted projects for show and tellSnacks to share (optional)Materials ProvidedVariety of origami papersInstructional guidesBasic tools (rulers, pencil, paper cutter, glue)Who is Roligami?Roli Agrawal, fondly known as roligami, is a multi-disciplinary designer and passionate craft enthusiast. Inspired by her love for Japanese culture, she has been exploring and teaching origami for over a decade. Roli’s workshops are a celebration of creativity, and her delightful creations are showcased on Instagram @roligami.Join us and add a handmade touch to your holiday cheer!

name: Food In Literature Book Club
description: Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.  So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.January Read: In the Beginning there was Bombay Duck by Pronoti DattaWe assure you that you will enjoy every single bite! The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who love to read and eat!When: Saturday, 31st January, 2026 at 11 a.m.Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira NagarAges: 18+Registration is mandatory (link in bio)Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: Let Poetry Be
description: This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!Date: 24th JanuaryTime: 4pm Venue: Atta Galatta, IndiranagarEvent specifics & submission guidelines –1. Theme - Free Verse (any original work)2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live3. All languages welcome4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 22nd Jan midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for-January LPB meet-up'7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.comYou are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: Slow Sunday by the Eleven AM Club
description: A very happy new year! ✨We’re kicking off the first Slow Sunday of the year with something hands-on, playful, and quietly rewarding: decorating your own deck of cards.Bring along a set of old playing cards and transform them however you like — markers, collage, minimal black-and-white, words, poetry, symbols, chaos. You could even swap a card with your tablemates and design one for each other.By the end, you’ll have a one-of-a-kind deck and, at the very least, a great conversation starter the next time you play bluff (or any card game, really).As always, come as you are. Make, watch, chat, or just be.See you for a slow, creative start to the year ♡About the clubWhat is the Eleven AM Club A space for slow, intentional gatherings where time stretches, stories unfold, and creativity finds room to breathe. At Eleven AM Club, we come together to write, draw, cook, read, play, or simply be—no rush, no agenda, just a day well spent.

name: Pitch and Pair: Pitch your single friend
description: Got a single friend who’s a total catch? 👀This is your chance to be the ultimate wing-person. Create a fun 3–5 minute slide deck hyping them up — their quirks, charm, and best qualities — and pitch them to a room full of singles.But Pitch & Pair isn’t just about the presentations — it’s a full evening designed to spark real connections:🎲 Connection Hunt: A playful way to turn strangers into familiar faces.🎤 Friend Pitches: Hilarious, heartfelt presentations that will have the room cheering.💌 Secret Match Reveal: Where the real chaos — and the magic — begins. All revealed at the end!🍸 Single-Mingle Party: Stay back for drinks and conversations that dating apps can’t create.Whether you’re pitching a friend, cheering them on, or just there to meet new people — this is your night to laugh, mingle, and maybe leave with a story worth telling.

name: Poetry Open Mic
description: Event Name: Mohlat: Zamaane ke fasaane seTheme: Poetry, Storytelling & Unfiltered ConversationsIn a city that runs on deadlines, traffic, and endless scrolling, when was the last time you truly paused?Mohlat (meaning 'respite' or 'grace period') is not just an event; it is a sanctuary carved out of time. We invite you to "Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening dedicated to the art of slowing down.This is a space where the noise of the world fades away, replaced by the rhythm of poetry and the warmth of stories. Whether you are a Shayar with a diary full of couplets, a storyteller with a memory to share, or a listener looking for sukoon (peace), you belong here.WHAT TO EXPECT ✨ The Mehfil Vibe: Forget cold auditoriums. Imagine warm lights, floor seating (cushions and rugs), and a circle of strangers who feel like old friends.🎙️ The Open Mic: The stage is open to everyone. Hindi, Urdu, English, or Hinglish—language is no barrier when the emotion is real. Share your Nazms, Ghazals, or free-verse stories.☕ Chai & Guftagu: What is a poetry session without tea? Enjoy light refreshments and engage in meaningful conversations during our breaks.WHO IS THIS FOR?The Writer who has been hiding their poetry in the Notes app.The Listener who finds comfort in the words of others.The Soul looking to disconnect from screens and reconnect with people.NOTE: This is a zero-judgment zone. You don't need to be a professional performer. You just need to be authentic.

name: Shibari Classes For Beginners
description: This is an immersive learning space for people who want to practice Shibari but haven't found the right space, people or facilitator in India to learn from.The goal of these six week courses is to facilitate regular, structured Shibari practice that aims to go deep rather than broad, helping you to develop a really firm grasp of rope bondage fundamentals, build muscle memory, and get to know other participants. The classes will be conducted every Saturday afternoon and will be led by Amiya, Founder of Silly Hands Shibari.The 6-week cohort is limited to a select group of registered participants only. No walk-ins.Each ticket gives you entry for 2 People i.e you + your rope partner. What is Shibari?Shibari is a contemporary form of rope bondage that was originated in Japan in the early 1200-1800's. Later popularized in the 21st century as a pleasure-craft. Shibari, despite its various styles, adheres to a certain aesthetic and exclusively uses ropes as a primary tool to build trust and connect with oneself and others.What to expect?3 hour weekly in-person hands-on lessons100% Vetted ParticipantsJapanese Asanawa (Hemp ropes) for the classFree access to Rope Jams1:1 Technical & Safety guidance throughout the programPost-course integration supportLimited Edition SHS MerchThis is a structured learning space that explores mind–body engagement through rope. The course supports flexibility in awareness, communication, and embodied practice, using rope as a practical and intentional tool. Safety, consent, and consistency remain central to the learning process.We will cover the fundamental knots, frictions, patterns, harnesses, and introduces participants to important skills such as rope handling and tensioning. By the end of the course, participants should understand how to construct a short rope scene that brings together technical and playful elements.Further InformationDates: Every Saturday starting 24th January, 2 pm - 5 pm.Where: The Bangalore Local, Koramangala, Bengaluru.Who can Join :Adults 21+ with no prior experience but plenty interest, LGBTQIA+ solo or with a rope partner.The ticket gives you entry for 2 People i.e you + your rope partner.Participants who sign up solo are encouraged to partner up with another solo-participant to practice the ties on each other. If you don’t want to switch (both tie and be tied), then we would recommend coming with a partner.About the Facilitator: Amiya Bhanushali (she/they) is a queer multidisciplinary artist, contemporary curator and creative strategist. Her work explores art, human connection and design across all disciplines, with a focus on Indian and South Asian narratives. They began to explore Shibari in 2022 as an extension of their art and research into kink-based practices. As their style naturally progressed beyond aesthetics alone, they began to discover interconnections between queerness, pleasure, trauma and neurodivergence.Questions? Email us at sillyhands.shibari@gmail.com

name: Federica Colangelo Acquaphonica presents “Forward”
description: About Aquaphonica:Acquaphonica is a contemporary jazz project led by Italian pianist and composer Federica Colangelo, conceived as a long-term creative laboratory where composition, improvisation, and cross-cultural rhythmic research converge.The trio explores a personal musical language shaped by contemporary jazz, 20th-century Western music, and South Indian Carnatic rhythmic traditions, with a strong focus on form, texture, and collective interaction.The current project, Forward, expands the trio format through the special participation of Carnatic percussion master B.C. Manjunath, deepening the rhythmic dimension and opening new perspectives on groove, time, and improvisation.About the artists:FEDERICA COLANGELO: piano, compositionFederica Colangelo is an Italian pianist and composer born in Rome. After studying classical piano at the Royal School of London, she moved to the Netherlands in her early twenties, where she continued her studies in jazz piano and later in contemporary composition.During her years in the Netherlands, she founded Acquaphonica, a project conceived from the outset as a creative laboratory for her original music. With Acquaphonica she has released three albums of original compositions: Private Enemy (2012), Chiaroscuro (2016), and Endless Tail (2019). The fourth album, Forward, is forthcoming and will be presented in October 2025.Her work is characterized by continuous exploration and experimentation, drawing from jazz improvisation and compositional practices, 20th-century European and American music (including influences such as Charles Ives, Philip Glass, John Cage, and Igor Stravinsky), and the rich rhythmic traditions of South Indian Carnatic music. These elements form the basis of her distinctive compositional voice.Alongside Acquaphonica, Colangelo writes and arranges music for various ensembles. Notable works include Undecided (2010) for a 14-piece orchestra, composed during a close collaboration with Dutch composer Otto Ketting and later performed and recorded by the HKU Conservatory Youth Orchestra. In 2014 she arranged six traditional Bulgarian songs for string quintet, presented at the Apollonia Art Festival (Bulgaria). In 2016 she arranged her composition Graphic Work (from the album Chiaroscuro, Alfa Music) for the Civica Big Band, performed at Teatro Piccolo di Milano within the “New Generations” series.In May 2024 she launched Advaita Crescendo, an international quintet formed in Amsterdam, bringing together Indian and Western musicians: veena virtuoso Dr. Suma Sudhindra, flutist and composer Ned McGowan, percussionist Karthik Mani, bassist Laurent Peckels, and Federica Colangelo on piano. The project blends European composition with Carnatic melodic, rhythmic, and improvisational concepts in the search for a shared musical language.She is also active in the duo Timelines with vocalist Giulia Cianca, currently working on an album inspired by the life and writings of Joyce Lussu.Since 2021, Federica Colangelo has been teaching Jazz Composition at the Conservatories of Campobasso and Udine.Throughout her career she has collaborated with numerous internationally active musicians and performed at festivals and venues across Europe and India.IGOR LEGARI – double bassIgor Legari is an Italian double bassist, improviser, and educator based in Rome since 2011, where he is an active presence in the jazz and improvised music scene.His trio ARBO, with Marco Colonna and Ermanno Baron, released its debut album in 2022 on Folderol Records, receiving widespread critical acclaim, including being cited among the best Italian jazz albums of the year. In March 2024 he recorded Something About It, the debut album of Fabrizio Sferra’s new quartet featuring Francesco Bearzatti and Giovanni Guidi, to be released by Parco della Musica Records.Legari is a member of Ettore Fioravanti’s Opus Magnum, with which he has released two albums (Opus Magnum, AlfaMusic 2019; Attraverso ogni confine, Parco della Musica Records 2022). He is also part of pianist Francesco Negro’s trio, with whom he has recorded three albums between 2011 and 2022.He collaborates extensively with composer Teho Teardo, both for film and fashion soundtracks and for live multimedia productions. Together with Susanna Buffa, he created the project Quando l’Anarchia Verrà, dedicated to libertarian songs of the 19th and 20th centuries, published in December 2024 by Kurumuny.A founding member of the trio LUZ, he has toured extensively across Europe and recorded two albums for Auand Records. He has also been a key figure in the Roman improvisation collective Franco Ferguson.Legari holds a diploma in Jazz Double Bass from the Conservatorio di Santa Cecilia in Rome and a degree in Sociology. He has taught Jazz Ensemble at the Conservatorio “F. Morlacchi” of Perugia.GIOVANNI NARDIELLO – drumsBorn in 1995, Giovanni Nardiello began his musical journey at a young age, influenced by his father. He started his professional career at 16, performing in projects ranging from indie rock to pop, experiences that led him to open concerts for major Italian artists such as Marlene Kuntz, Thegiornalisti, and members of Afterhours.In parallel, he began studying jazz in 2015, focusing on improvisation and contemporary languages. He studied with leading figures of the international jazz scene, including Gregory Hutchinson, Ziv Ravitz, Jim Black, Stefano Battaglia, and Ralph Alessi.In 2021 he moved to Tallinn, where he studied Contemporary Improvisation at the Estonian Academy of Music and Theatre and took part in masterclasses with artists such as Marc Ribot and Le Quan Ninh.He has been involved in several award-winning projects, including the Alessandro Pennino Trio, which won the Val d’Agri Jazz Festival and recorded the album Memento (2019, WoW Records). His project Perspectives was a finalist at the Premio Isio Saba 2023.In 2022 he released Kairi with the trio Triologic, featuring guest trumpeter Ralph Alessi. Currently based in Siena, he is working on his first album as a leader while collaborating with numerous contemporary jazz and experimental ensembles.SPECIAL GUESTB.C. MANJUNATH – Carnatic percussionB.C. Manjunath is one of the leading exponents of South Indian Carnatic percussion of his generation. Trained within the traditional Carnatic system, he is internationally recognized for his mastery of mridangam and konnakol, as well as for his ability to engage in cross-cultural musical contexts.Active both in India and internationally, he has collaborated with leading figures of Indian classical music and with musicians from the jazz and contemporary music worlds. His work is distinguished by a deep rhythmic sophistication, precision, and a strong sense of musical dialogue.Within Acquaphonica – Forward, Manjunath’s participation expands the trio’s rhythmic framework, introducing Carnatic rhythmic concepts into an open improvisational context. His presence plays a central role in redefining time, groove, and interaction, contributing decisively to the project’s sonic identity.

name: Serious Slice
description: Welcome to Naples. Well, almost. At Serious Slice, we take our Napoli roots very seriously. Every dish, every process is driven by a deep obsession with Neapolitan pizza and the streets that shaped it, where time, fire, and simplicity do the heavy lifting.Our dough ferments for 72 hours before it ever meets the flame, creating crusts that are light, airy, and blistered just the way Napoli intended. The tomatoes are always San Marzano, bright and balanced. The mozzarella melts soft and gentle. Every pizza carries the soul of a city that takes its food personally.Whether you swear by the OG Margherita or chase bolder flavours, the craft always remains the constant.At our flagship on Cunningham Road, we’ve kept things honest and unfussy. Walk through the blue doors and you enter a warm, intimate space — mosaic art on the walls with quiet nods to Naples, and the crackle of fire you hear instantly from our open kitchen. No backstage. Just dough, flame, and movement.With just 40 seats and an open kitchen, Serious Slice is intimate, warm, and always led by the food and the craft.Weekends are seriously special: Every weekend, we roll out two limited-edition pizzas that don’t stick around for long. Tartufo-E-Fungi – with button mushrooms, capers, pecorino cheese, and a heady drizzle of truffle oil — earthy, bold, and seriously indulgent. Napoli Salsiccia – with Italian sausage, fresh mozzarella, onion, red paprika, and button mushrooms — smoky, spicy, and unapologetically Napoli. Available only on weekends, and when they’re gone, they’re gone.We’re open every day from 12 PM to 11 PM — perfect for lazy lunches, late dinners, and everything in between. We also roll out frequent off-menu pizza and panuozzo drops — one-day-only creations that appear without warning and disappear just as fast, in limited quantities every time. Follow us so you never miss our flavour drops. We take loyalty seriously: Collect stamps on your Serious Passport and chase the flavour. Ask our staff to give you our loyalty card - to win free panuozzos and pizzas of your choosing. Please Note: We’re a 40-seater, so reservations are recommended on weekends. Limited specials and collab menus are first-come, first-served. Panuozzos take a little extra time — they’re worth the wait. Special events and collabs may run on timed seating.Serious Slice, Cunningham Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka.

name: A Southern Italian Supper Club - Amalfi Amore
description: SPECIAL 2 FOR LESS OFFER ON COUPLE TICKETS﻿Amalfi Amore - A Southern Italian Supper Club with Chef Natasha Celmi from Naples, Italy. Step into a warm, intimate Italian afternoon which takes you straight to the Amalfi Coast. Citrus theme decor, Italian country music and the cosy ambience of Canella Studio.A gourmet seven course Sunday afternoon indulgence where every course showcases Italian family traditions, stories and hand picked artisan ingredients brought back by the Chef from her home on the Italian coast. Includes an Amalfi Lemon Spritz drink.Limited seats so get your gang together soon.We offer both vegetarian and meat / seafood menu.A presto !MENU: 🫒 ANTIPASTI TO SHAREFocaccia, white bean mash & citrus olives, red pepper crema & zucchini,🍋 Homemade Limoncello Drink🍅 Caprese Burrata Tart- deconstructed !🥗 Insalata - citrus, rucola, fennelRisotto🍤 Seafood & saffron OR🍄‍🟫 Mixed mushrooms & truffle🍝 Stuffed Pasta ShellsRicotta, spinach, fresh tomato or mince lamb sauce, Parmesan crisps, capers🍨 🧁 Amalfi lemons cheesecake gelato, limoncello cake☕️ Cafe’ &  chocolate truffles.

organizer.name: Canella Studio
organizer.description: Canella Studio is a vibrant culinary space in Bangalore led by Chef Natasha Celmi. We offer hands-on, joyful cooking experiences focused on simple, flavorful dishes that nourish body and soul. Join us to learn, laugh, and create memories around food and community.

name: Quiet Joys: A Gratitude Zine–Making Workshop
description: Join us for an afternoon of quiet creativity. This workshop invites you to slow down, reflect on the small joys that often go unnoticed, and turn those moments into an 8-page gratitude zine. Through gentle prompts and simple illustration exercises, you’ll create a personal keepsake that captures what grounded you, moved you, or made you smile. It’s a reflective, hands-on session for anyone seeking a pause through creativity and mindful noticing. All materials will be provided, and no prior art experience is required.

name: Bad Daughter Book Salon: Book Discussion
description: BECAUSE GOOD GIRLS DON’T CHANGE THE WORLD. For every woman who has been told she's "too much," this is a memoir about becoming exactly who you're meant to be.Sangeeta Pillai was called a "Bad Daughter" for defying the rigid expectations placed on "good Indian girls." But in her rebellion, she found her voice. From a harrowing childhood in a Mumbai slum-haunted by a violent father and the brutal murder of her mother-this is a story of resilience. With a fire in her belly, shebattled patriarchy, chased her dreams, and built a new life in London, creating a successful podcast to inspire other women. Yet, all her success couldn't outrun the past. Faced with debilitating mental health, she explored many healing avenues from psychotherapy, hypnotherapy, EMDR, acupuncture to Tantra. But to truly heal, she had to go back to her birthplace: tropical Kerala to confront her deep trauma. There, she experienced the most profound spiritual transformation in Kerala's ancient temples. Sangeeta's powerful, spiritual and deeply inspiring journey shows us that healing means finding your way back home to yourself. Bad Daughter is an inspirational feminist memoir for every woman who wants to break free. Ultimately, it's a reminder that the courage to be your authentic self can transform your own life - and the lives of those around you.Author Description:Sangeeta Pillai grew up in a Mumbai slum. Today, she is recognised as a leading voice for South Asian feminism globally. Award-winning podcaster, writer and feminist activist, Sangeeta is the creator of Masala Podcast (all about cultural taboos) which won 6 British Podcast Awards, 1 Audio Production Award & Spotify SoundUp 2018 award. She's also the founder of South Asian feminist network Soul Sutras. Sangeeta has been featured extensively in the press from BBC Radio, Guardian, Metro, Cosmopolitan, Evening Standard, Stylist, Eastern Eye to Huffington Post. As well as on giant billboards in New York, London, Dublin, Cardiff & Glasgow. She is also the creator of the Masala Monologues series of writing workshops & theatre shows in the UK & the US. Sangeeta is a regular speaker at WOW Festival, Podcast Show London, Shameless Festival, Primadonna Festival as well as being a regular speaker on innumerable panels and podcasts.

name: Daphne du Maurier Reader Meetup
description: Daphne du Maurier’s writing is a haunting blend of atmosphere, suspense, and psychological depth. With her gift for crafting moody landscapes, ambiguous characters, and stories that linger long after the last page, she draws readers into worlds where the familiar becomes unsettling and the ordinary glimmers with mystery. From windswept Cornish cliffs to shadowed manor houses, her narratives explore love, identity, obsession, and the quiet menace of the unknown.Her novels and short stories – whether it’s the iconic Rebecca, the eerie tension of Jamaica Inn, or the chilling brilliance of “The Birds” – continue to captivate generations of readers who crave storytelling that is both immersive and unsettlingly beautiful.Whether you have long been enthralled by du Maurier’s atmospheric prose or are just beginning to step into her shadowed, intriguing worlds, you are warmly invited to join us this month as we gather to discuss, reflect, and lose ourselves in her unforgettable stories.

name: THT & Tajdar Junaid present Ruuh-Bakhsh
description: About Ruuh BakhshRuuh-Bakhsh is formed by Tajdar Junaid, Satyaki Banerjee and Rabi Mondal in an effort to play and conserve folk music. (erstwhile named Ruhaniyat) "Ruuh-Bakhsh (Ruhaniyat) are a folk band with edge from the Indian city of Calcutta"Tajdar Junaid is a Film Composer and Music Producer based out of Mumbai with his roots in Calcutta. His collaborations include work across mediums - composing for Iranian filmmaker Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Coke Studio Bharat, Spanish animated feature Sultana’s Dream, Emma Thompson’s Sold, amongst many others. His passion resides with world cinema, long walks in nature and teaching young minds as a visiting faculty at National Institute of Design, Ahmedabad and Indian Institute of Management Calcutta. The films that he has composed for have gone on to be nominated in The Best Documentary Feature category at The Oscars (Writing with Fire, 2022) Nomination for Best Animation Film at The Goya Awards (Sultana’s Dream, 2024) National Film Award (Mukti Bhawan/Hotel Salvation, 2017) More of his musical ventures at http://www.tajdarjunaid.com/Satyaki Banerjee is a highly eclectic musician who has a natural affinity for plucked instruments, both classical and folk. He studied the sarod with the late Pandit Dipak Chowdhury and now trains under Pandit Tejendra Narayan Majumdar. He picked up the dotara in the company of practising folk musicians and in him folk and classical elements meld and mix to evolve into a unique style of playing. He is also a self-taught oud and rabab player, besides being a magnificent singer of mostly Bengali mystical poetry, in the baul and kirtan traditions. He works independently and with other artistes and theatre groups, including with singer-songwriter/ethnomusicologist Moushumi Bhowmik, actor Gautam Haldar and performer/academic Sudipto Chatterjee. He is the organising secretary of Kolkata's major folk event, the Baul Fakir Utsav. Satyaki is a historian by training and takes serious academic interest in the music he practices. Satyaki has performed at prestigious music festivals like the Rainforest world music festival in Malaysia, theatre festivals in Bangladesh, House of World Culture in Berlin.Rabi Mondal is a folk musician from Shantiniketan, the land of folklore and travelling minstrels. He has been groomed in the tradition of Baul, the mystical poets of Bengal. He has performed with acclaimed artists such as Moushumi Bhowmik, Pt. Tanmoy Bose (Pt.Ravi Shankar’s Tabla player) and has been a part of the prestigious Coke Studio TV series which focuses on bringing musicians from different genres together. He has an ashram in his native village that he takes care of and spends time farming, carpentry and crafting musical instruments. Rabi sings and performs with the dotara, khamak, dupki and various folk percussion instruments.As a folk band, Ruuh-Bakhsh, has performed at various festivals in India and internationally, namely at the Barbican in London, Celtic festival in Scotland, Blue Frog in Mumbai,India amongst others.The Humming Tree:The Humming Tree - A grassroots performance venue in Bangalore, running from 2013 to 2019 and in the process becoming a cornerstone of Bangalore’s independent music, art, and cultural ecosystem. Now, in 2026, The Humming Tree is back in a brand-new, purpose-designed space in Indiranagar. Built across 12,000 sq. ft., the venue features a 600+ capacity performance space, world-class sound and lighting systems, and a diverse F&B proposition. More than just a venue, it’s a hub for creativity, culture and collaboration.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no one taking selfies, and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation.The event will be fluid - you can dip into activities if you want, or chat with new people, or graze at our high tea counter! Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be using social media on our phones at the event; we will only take photos with a camera. Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age!Strictly no devices (no laptops, iPads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag.  E-books are allowed.**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours!

name: INDISHMAN: Book reading by Dr Gopi Chandroth
description: Dr Gopi Chandroth, author of INDISHMAN – Reflections from India, Britain and the Sea, will be at Atta Galatta Bookstore in Indiranagar on 1 February, from 4.30 pm to 6 pm. He will talk about selected stories and engage informally with the audience. Signed copies of the book will be on sale.The following are sample extracts from reviews on Amazon globally and on Goodreads:• India: “INDISHMAN reminded me of the lyrical beauty of Arundhati Roy, the vivid storytelling of Salman Rushdie, and the magic of García Márquez.”• UK: “A lovely meander through the vagaries of human nature. Each story warms the heart like a good malt whisky. A very well-written book; I defy anyone not to enjoy it.”• USA: “It (INDISHMAN) is hard to slot into a specific genre – the stories, reflections and gentle musings flit from rural Kerala to Nepal, from Southampton to the high seas with ease. They strike the perfect balance between being sharply observed and deeply memorable, yet light enough for an effortlessly enjoyable read, and never without a touch of humour and heart. Without a doubt, this has been the best six dollars and change I’ve spent in a very long time.”

name: Art of Erotic Writing - A Workshop
description: Sex is an inevitable part of our lives. Most of us indulge in either doing it, dreaming it, dreading it or otherwise thinking about it at some point in time. Years of social conditioning makes us consider it as ‘undesirable’, ‘immoral’ and ‘dirty’ but in fact, it is ‘desirable’, ‘natural’ and ‘healthy’.In this workshop, you can learn to navigate the fine line between titillating and tacky, and discover how to craft compelling erotic content. Explore various aspects of sexuality and sensuality. Discover your niche and develop your skills in writing erotic content that resonates with your audience. Gain relevant information and techniques to enhance your writing, and take away valuable tips to apply to your own work.

description: Shaam-e-Baazgasht is an intimate, cosy, and immersive poetry experience drawn from Baazgasht – Echoes of Words & Silence, a bilingual Hindi–English collection that journeys through unrequited love, longing, heartbreak, queerness, healing, and the quiet courage of letting go.More than a performance, it is a gathering that invites presence.Through selected poems from the Baazgasht series, the evening unfolds alongside the stories that birthed them — gentle, honest conversations with the poet on his own journey, interwoven with brief guided moments of breathing, mindfulness, and emotional reflection. Together, these elements create a space where words are not merely heard, but felt — allowing the audience to touch closure, clarity, and a softer, steadier kind of inner peace.Shaam-e-Baazgasht | Bengaluru Diaries offers an evening of listening, pausing, and returning — to oneself.

name: Dinner with strangers by StepOut (Bengaluru)
description: Serendipity on a TableStepOut Dinners bring strangers together at some of the city’s best restaurants for an evening that feels easy, warm, and unexpectedly meaningful.You are seated at a small, thoughtfully curated table with people you would likely never meet otherwise. Different backgrounds, different stories, one shared meal. The crowd is balanced, open minded, and there by choice, not chance. No loud networking. No awkward icebreakers. Just good food, unforced conversations, and the kind of listening that rarely happens in daily life.The restaurants are carefully chosen. Comfortable, well loved spaces where you can settle in and talk without rushing. The focus is not on the menu alone, but on the atmosphere that allows connection to unfold naturally.Some nights are light and playful. Some go deeper than expected. Some surprise you quietly. That is the point.StepOut Dinners are not about dating or outcomes. They are about discovery. Showing up. Sitting down. Letting the table do its quiet work.Sometimes, all it takes is one seat at the right table for life to feel a little more open. For more information, visit www.stepout.world

name: Launch of Three New Titles by Red River Authors
description: Join us on 25th January, Sunday, from 5 pm to 7 pm, for the launch of books by Ankush Banerjee, Babitha Marina Justin, and Salini Vineeth, published by Red River.We’re excited to unveil three unique books and to have an engaging discussion about these books and their themes – myth, memory, resilience, and gender identity.Field Notes on Kindness by Ankush Banerjee is a collection of poems that are inspired from memories, anecdotes, and characters in the family, but recast them with an eye for detail and an attitude of pure wonder.The Way Madmen Smell by Babitha Marina Justin is a collection of ten stories that move between the real, the unreal, and the surreal, weaving themes of love, loss, memory, betrayal, and resilience.The Tree, The Well & the Drag Queen by Salini Vineeth is a novella that blends folklore, myth, and magic with a contemporary exploration of gender identity as it follows a queer person’s quest for freedom and authenticity.We cordially invite you to an engaging literary discussion as we celebrate these three books!About the Authors:Ankush Banerjee is a Kochi-based poet, educator, book reviewer, and research scholar in masculinity studies. His work appears in numerous print and online platforms. This is his second book of poems.Babitha Marina Justin is a writer and visual artist who moves easily between a paintbrush and a pen. Her poetry lingers on memory, gender, and the small intimacies of everyday life, with a voice that can be tender one moment and uncompromising the next. She has written nine books, including three poetry collections, Of Fireflies, Guns and the Hills (2015), I Cook My Own Feast (2019), and Forty-Five Shades of Brown (2023). She also co-edited salt, pepper and silver linings: celebrating our grandmothers (2019), a tribute to resilience and inheritance.Salini Vineeth is a fiction writer and translator. She worked as an engineer for ten years before moving to full-time writing in 2019. Since then, she has published five books — Lost Edges (novel, 2023), Magic Square (novella, 2020), Everyday People (short story collection, 2019), and travel guides for Hampi and Badami. She has also translated four books from English to Malayalam. She is the fiction editor of Mean Pepper Vine, a quarterly literary magazine. salinivineeth.in

name: Pint of View (Lecture 30): A Matter of Taste
description: While you munch on your dinner, think about which food item you truly like. Ever wondered why you like that so much?Do we actually know how taste works? When was the last time you tried to explain why you like something?Not just “it’s good,” but why it’s good. Why this coffee works for you but another doesn’t. Why a certain smell makes you feel at home. Why some flavours feel comforting and others feel like too much effort.Most of us realise, mid-sentence, that we don’t quite have the language for it.That’s because taste isn’t just happening in the mouth. It’s shaped by memory, by smell, by repetition, by culture, by the small habits we pick up without noticing. Flavour is something we learn, even when we think we haven’t.What if we tell you that the next lecture will give you the framework to decode, understand and express taste and flavour like how you always wanted to. No more “yummy”, no more “delicious” as you find ways to convey flavour in this lecture-cum-food-writing-workshop.This Sunday at Pint of View, we’re spending an evening with someone who thinks about these things for a living.Your Speaker for the EveningShivani Unakar is a food researcher and creative practitioner based in Bangalore. Her work uses food as a way of thinking about people, place, and the systems that connect them.Over the past decade, she has worked across kitchens, farms, breweries, small businesses, FMCG brands, and food media platforms. Her practice is grounded in fieldwork, observation, and sensory exploration, and is driven by curiosity about how food carries memory and meaning.She brings this sensibility to A Matter of Taste, inviting us to pay attention to something we experience every day but rarely stop to examine.About the LectureFlavour isn't just in food, it's also in us.In the lecture A Matter of Taste, Shivani Unakar will unpack how we taste, describe, and design flavour.First, a look at the hidden art and science of tasting, from the way our brains perceive and interpret flavour through smell and memory, to how professionals in coffee, beer, wine and more train their senses to make the invisible visible.The lecture looks at flavour not as a fixed property of food, but as something shaped by perception, training, culture, and design. It moves from the inner workings of taste to the worlds that influence it, and asks how our understanding of flavour is changing.Event Details📍 1st Floor, Atta Galatta, Indiranagar📅 Sunday, 18th Jan, 4–6 pmSober drinks for the evening will be provided by Local Ferment Co..

About the FacilitatorSneha is a sound healer, mindfulness guide, and someone who’s walked the path from burnout to inner clarity. After years in the corporate world as a CA, I made an intentional shift, from spreadsheets to sound bowls, from deadlines to deep presence. Life gave me the courage to tune into my inner wisdom, and that led me here- to the path of healing, mindfulness, and holding space for othersToday, I blend sound healing, mindfulness, and psychology to help people feel more grounded, present, and connected to themselves. My work is heart-led, real, and rooted in everything I have experienced & learnt along the way.

name: The Next Chapter Hour by Divya Arathi M.
description: 🌿 About the SessionThis is a 60-minute guided reflection experience designed to help you pause, reconnect, and step into your next chapter with clarity, energy, and direction. Unlike most year-end or new-year sessions, this is not about productivity, goal-setting, or doing more.It’s about slowing down, noticing, and honoring the journey that brought you here.In this session, you will:🧘‍♀️ Pause and return to the present moment🌊 Reflect with gratitude, without judgment🧭 Explore Clarity, Energy, and Direction through simple, grounded tools✍️ Work with a practical worksheet you can revisit🌅 Leave feeling calmer, clearer, and gently oriented toward what’s nextNo preparation required. No pressure to perform. Just a quiet, intentional space to begin.Who is Divya? “Before you plan the next chapter, have you met the one who made it here?” Divya Arathi is someone who listens deeply, notices the in-between moments, and believes that clarity often arrives when we stop trying so hard. She brings a calm, grounded presence into the spaces she holds, inviting people to slow down, breathe, and return to themselves. As the founder of The Coach Codega, she designs experiences that help people begin again — not from pressure or urgency, but from presence, clarity, and a gentle sense of direction.

name: A Walk in the Backyard: Nature journaling workshop
description: A Walk in the Backyard is a gentle, slow-paced nature journaling workshop designed to help you pause, observe, and reconnect with the small wonders around you. Inspired by the philosophy of John Muir Laws—observation, curiosity, and wonder—this session invites participants to look closely at everyday nature: backyard birds, leaves, flowers, insects, sounds, and fleeting moments that often go unnoticed.You don’t need to be an artist or a writer. Nature journaling is not about perfection—it’s about paying attention. Through simple prompts, guided observation, and easy watercolor and drawing exercises, you’ll learn how to record what you see, feel, and wonder about in your own sketchbook.This workshop is perfect if you want to:Slow down and be present in the momentBuild a regular nature journaling habitExplore watercolor and sketching in a relaxed, pressure-free wayReconnect with your curiosity and childlike sense of wonderUse art as a calming, mindful practiceBy the end of the session, you’ll walk away with:A completed nature journal pageSimple tools and prompts you can reuse at homeIncreased confidence in observing and expressing natureA calmer, more grounded state of mindAll materials will be provided.About the FacilitatorThe workshop is facilitated by Charu Jain, a self-taught watercolor artist and illustrator with a deep love for storytelling and nature journaling.Charu’s work is rooted in gentle observation, expressive lines, and a playful, hand-drawn watercolor style. She believes art is a way to slow down, listen deeply, and build a personal relationship with the natural world. Her practice combines illustration, journalling, and storytelling to make creativity feel accessible rather than intimidating.Through her workshops, Charu encourages participants to let go of “getting it right” and instead focus on noticing, wondering, and enjoying the process. Her sessions are known for being warm, inclusive, and thoughtfully guided—especially welcoming to beginners.

description: The Counterpoint Crew presents Sounds like LoveThis Valentine’s Day, step into a screen-free musical experience for an hour at Underline Centre, Indiranagar where 20 voices bring an unplugged concert with nothing but human voices.Across Kannada, Tamil, Hindi, Malayalam, Telugu, and English, familiar tunes are presented as an unique listening experience, where you sit back, take it in and let the sound move you. Designed as an intimate Valentine’s evening, it works whether you come solo, with a date, or with friends—no participation pressure.Format: Seated, immersive a cappella concert.Timing:• Doors open: 5:00 PM• Show: 5:30 PM – 6:30 PMCode of Conduct:• No smoking.• No alcohol on the premises.• Please keep phones on silentFood:• A food stall will be open before and after the show for purchases.• The stall will remain closed during the performance to keep the room quiet and focused.About the CrewThe Counterpoint Crew is an 20-member vocal ensemble based in Bangalore that blends classical techniques with contemporary repertoire. Born from a love of rich harmonies and collaborative arrangement, the Crew presents vocal textures that move fluidly between contemporary melodies, film music and western choral numbers. The crew contributed a brief background score to the acclaimed Kantara: Chapter 1. They have also collaborated with independent songwriters and composers along the way. The crew is committed to bringing choral music to a wider audience by performing relatable numbers in their set list.

name: #33: Martian Tales from a Former NASA Scientist
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.In our thirty third lecture, we’re bringing you Nimisha Mittal, a veteran space systems engineer with over 15 years of experience at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). She led operations and testing for some of the world’s most ambitious robotic missions including the Cassini mission at Saturn, three of NASA's five Mars rovers, the Insight Mars lander, and most recently the NASA-ISRO SAR mission, NISAR. After a career of exploring the solar system, she's just completed her own mission of relocating to India. With engineering degrees from UT Austin and Stanford, she's now turning her attention from exploring other worlds to helping build the future of the Indian space industry.Her talk, Martian Tales from a Former NASA Engineer, dives into the thrill of driving robots across another planet and the bigger question of why Mars captivates us so deeply. Is it the search for life, the dream of a second home, or something even more profound? With insider stories from her time on the Mars mission, she takes us through what a day on the Red Planet really looks like, the challenges of remote space exploration, and even what it takes to earn a Martian Driver’s License.Come find out, and bring your questions — from whether humans can truly settle on Mars to what snacks power a NASA engineer through a 12-hour shift.All of this, over beer or mocktail on tap at The Humming Tree, Indiranagar! 🍻What to Expect:A 60-minute lecture on the realities of life on the Red Planet, from exploration to insider NASA stories15–20 minutes of interactive Q&AOne Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticketA lively mixer to share your insightsEvent Details:📅 Thursday, 29th October | 7 PM – 9 PM📍 The Humming Tree, 100 ft Road, Indiranagar🎫 Limited to 250 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for the first few ticketsAbout the LecturerNimisha Mittal is a veteran space systems engineer with over 15 years of experience at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), where she led operations and testing for some of the world’s most ambitious robotic missions including the Cassini mission at Saturn, three of NASA's five Mars rovers, the Insight Mars lander, and most recently the NASA-ISRO SAR mission NISAR. After a career of exploring the solar system, she's just completed her own mission of relocating to India. With engineering degrees from UT Austin and Stanford, she's now turning her attention from exploring other worlds to helping build the future of the Indian space industry.About Pint of ViewInspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand while walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Crochet, Sip & Slow Down - Make your toy workshop
description: 🧶 Slow down, sip on matcha, and let your hands do the talking !In this cozy crochet workshop, you’ll learn the basics of crochet while creating your very own handmade toy—step by step, at a relaxed and beginner-friendly pace. No prior experience needed :)Crocheting is more than a craft. It’s a deeply calming, mindful practice that helps reduce stress, improve focus, and gently quiet the mind. The rhythmic movements support relaxation, enhance hand–eye coordination, and create a sense of accomplishment as you watch something take shape in your hands.This workshop is an invitation to unplug, create with intention, and experience the joy of slow making—leaving with a toy you’ve made yourself and a moment of calm you’ll carry with you.
